entities.name: Harry
entities.description: One of the participants in the competition, described as 'he' and 'him'. The text mentions Harry's reactions to the events unfolding.

entities.name: Cedric
entities.description: Another participant in the competition, who has successfully captured the golden egg. The text describes Cedric's achievement as 'very good indeed'.

entities.name: Bagman
entities.description: A judge or official in the competition, described as shouting and giving instructions to the participants.

entities.name: Miss Delacour
entities.description: A participant in the competition, who is about to take her turn. The text describes Fleur's trembling and her determination to perform well.

entities.name: Fleur
entities.description: Another name for Miss Delacour, used by Harry when describing her actions.

entities.name: Krum
entities.description: A participant in the competition, who is left alone with Harry after Fleur's turn. The text describes Krum as someone Harry and he are avoiding each other's gaze.

entities.name: dragon
entities.description: An obstacle that Cedric has overcome to capture the golden egg.

entities.name: golden egg
entities.description: The object of the competition, which is being captured by the participants. The text describes it as something that can be 'gotten past' and 'captured'.

relationships.description: The text states that Cedric has gotten past his dragon and captured the golden egg.
The text describes Bagman as shouting to the judges, who are holding up marks for the participants.
